While ONTAPSpot could have been a match made in multicloud heaven you instead have folks like CastAI tackling it And the various ways that ONTAP could have enabled this are all orphaned

Its a great question and since they also have CloudCheckr we cant view Spot as a cloud cost manager of which there are 20 players But NetApp pursued partner with each cloud and did MultipleCloudsWhichisNotMultiCloud Result

Well the value of ONTAP is significant and it is certainly NetApps biggest asset Its a pretty great piece of software with many wellintegrated and useful parts And I hope they got the value from AWS they deserve But a fit with their acquisitions And either driving growth

FSx for ONTAP doesnt introduce more customers to NetApp I have heard that its been extremely popular with nonNetApp customers However those relationships are owned by AWS How does NetApp get Spot in front of those net new customers

Its a software licensing deal so I doubt its a huge part of the revenue strategy vs a significant part of aligning to the customer journey and opening the door for a bigger customer relationship What I dont know is how

I think the level of effort needed to make ONTAP a first class AWS option is what has me curious about the overall strategy This was a heavy lift A nontrivial amount of resources both technical and PM had to go into it

Im sure AWS loves that ONTAP inside AWS surrounded by a SaaS marketplace of infinite solutions to all the other data problems But for NTAP I think its a bit like they decided to go the office for the QBR and forgot their pants
I think missing the server hardware side of the equation still makes any of the other suitors less appealing Even if they compliment each other That full stack is a compelling argument

Consider how much of the remaining revenue is simply a buyandgrow of things like Spot CloudJumper CloudCheckr If theyre really serious about software then not playing in metadata mgmt governance etc Instead they invested a ton in putting their core value into AWS

Its definitely possible but revenue doesnt lie 10K says product rev mix was 5545 softwarehw under product revenue eg not supportps Now look at a few NetApp quotes and see how much the ONTAP licensing is And then

NetApp is a better target for Google than Nutanix Files should live in the cloud and NetApp has built a good complementary cloudk8s business with spot cloudcheckr and other acquisitions Even for VMware complements vSAN alas the Dell board governance
